intro: Lampranthus antonii, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its bright, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often appearing in late winter to early spring. The plant is typically low-growing, with succulent leaves that help it store water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
